thread.title: Bharti Airtel Q2 net up 10.1% at Rs 1,523 crore
thread.title_full: Bharti Airtel Q2 net up 10.1% at Rs 1,523 crore | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: Dna Web desk
title: Bharti Airtel Q2 net up 10.1% at Rs 1,523 crore
text:
Bharti Airtel posted a 10.1% jump in net profit for the second quarter at Rs 1,523 crore. Last fiscal the telecom major had posted a net profit of Rs 1,383 crore, according to a release on BSE.
The company's total revenue rose 4.3% to Rs 23,836 crore in the quarter, versus Rs 22,845 crore in the year-ago period.
According to the company, its customer base went up to 339 million, up nearly 12% from 303 million customers in the September quarter last year.
For the India operations, the company's total revenue, however, was down to Rs 67.2 crore from the earlier Rs 72.5 crore in September 2014, a 7% drop.
The company's capital expenditure however, expanded nearly 199% to Rs 22 crore in the second quarter from the earlier Rs 7.4 crore.
The company's Africa operations revenue grew to Rs 6,895.6 crore from Rs 6,272.1 crore in the Jul-Sep quarter this year from the year-ago period.
In the period, the company expanded its capital expenditure in Africa from Rs 1,066.5 crore to Rs 1,602.1 crore.
At
10:20 IST Monday, the company's share price was Rs 359.20, up Rs 0.45 from previous day's close. The company's scrip had opened in the red on Monday.
